intro: Pelazoneuron clivale, commonly known as the cliff's crown, is a rare flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit and produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white and pale pink. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its leaves are typically thick and waxy, adapted to conserve moisture in arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pelazoneuron clivale is considered a vulnerable species.
